page.title: 15NAPTON BRICKWORKS
page.content: At Napton brickworks they used to make floor tiles, roof tiles and bricks. They made the tiles out of plastic clay. They got the clay from near the windmill, it was called a pit. Where 6 men were in a pit, 2 men were clearing the soil, 2 men were blowing the rock, 2 men were working on the clay digging it out. Then they sent it to the works in a dumper or a truck. The canal was at the bottom by the brickworks and was used to get coal to light the fires for the kilns. When the plastic clay got to the works it was ground, put through a grid and rollers and came out in a strip which was cut into squares, pressed and dried. 35000 were made a day. 110 people worked there. The bricks were sold to merchants all over the country. The canal was used to carry the bricks but later trucks were used.
